intro: Fagonia hadramautica, commonly known as the Hadramaut fagonia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments, with thick leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Fagonia hadramautica plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
